External link icons in core or not? https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4047

Add a global/standardized way to add icon to external links 路 Issue #4047 路 backdrop/backdrop-issues
In #4042 we have made it so that external links in the dashboard are indicated with an icon to the end of the link: I think that it would benefit all to have a consistent way to do this (say by add...

The extlink module gets added to pretty much all of my sites, so I'm not opposed.

Personally, I use it for the target="new".

What settings would get pulled over?

Ah, just read the discussion. Sounds like nothing really... I could see a core config page for "link handling" that would use the extlink settings.

Not a fan of making the theme handle the icons. It means every theme has to handle it. I do understand where that discussion is going though.

This topic is where telemetry would come in handy.
target="_blank" is a little problematic regarding web accessibility. We've discussed that before in an unrelated issue (don't remember which one it was).
@indigoxela IIRC, it was about exposing the "Open the link destination in a new window" checkbox in the "Insert link" dialog, so that it was outside the "More link options" fieldset: image.png
...which btw, it's how it works in the https://www.drupal.org/project/linkit module: image.png

Not a fan of making the theme handle the icons. It means every theme has to handle it.

Almost missed that... :wink: Personally, and as a contrib themes maintainer, I'd prefer if core (system - not core themes) provides as few icons and images as possible. They'll never fit all designs and overriding theme functions is more work than just adding a little CSS based on provided selectors.

And as someone who tries to do as little theming as possible, I prefer these things to be handled for me with the option of changing it if I want. :wink:

Curious why there would need to be a theme function if core were to just use CSS to display it in the first place? Override the icon in custom CSS and done?

Seriously though, I think core is fine to handle the classes and let a contrib handle additional settings and even icons.
